episodes.title: Kinley: The Movie
episodes.description:
KINLEY – Official Teaser (Coming August 2026)
Before the charts, before the doctrine, before the legend—there was a man in the Pentecostal healing circuit. KINLEY traces the early ministry of Henry C. Kinley, from his time in the Church of the Divine Healer, through controversy, alleged miracles, and his dramatic break from the church.

After a claimed divine revelation, Kinley founded his own school and began teaching a sweeping apocalyptic message—one that warned followers they would never live to see the year 2000.

Was he a visionary, a misunderstood preacher, or something else entirely?
This teaser is the first glimpse at a story that shaped thousands of lives.

Full film arriving August 2026.

episodes.title: Joshua and the Day the Sun Stood Still: Why it Would Destroy the Earth
Vision Was 1930, Not 1931: Glenn Kinley Reveals Katie Kinley’s Letter as Proof
episodes.description:
Glenn Kinley insisted that the vision was in 1930. Probably so he could correlate 930 years of Adam’s life span an arbitrary convenient number match. When Dr. Edward Mixon, or Dr. Robert Harris went to Henry himself with the year discrepancy of 1930, 1931, and even 1932  was spoken from Henry, he answered “ I don’t remember when it was. “ 
 The notable deans who inquired were satisfied with the blatant inconsistency instead interpreted as a lesson they needed to learn, that the date didn’t matter after all. 



*This video contains music from Shutterstock, licensed by Splice video editing app.

episodes.description: The Inner Sanctum: Los Angeles Friday Night Class - Prophecies Unleashed, Powers Contested, Devotions Divided, and IDMR's Shadowed End.

episodes.title: Why Humans Feel Compelled to Convince Others: Psychological Critique
“This Ain’t No Time for Kids” — How IDMR Made Motherhood Feel Wrong
Noah’s Flood: Ancient Myth or Modern IDMR Hoax?
Why They Did It? Psychologist Analyzes IDMR Home Robbery
episodes.description:
Certain members of the Detroit IDMR branch robbed a couple’s home while the wife was hospitalized and terminally ill. The theft went on for months, with members openly arguing among themselves about who was “entitled” to which items. Several other members who knew what was happening stayed silent, choosing not to alert the husband, who was out of town. Their silence made them complicit.

By the time the dust settled, everything of value had been taken — more than $100,000 in possessions. Investigations and prosecutions are still pending.

When the surviving owner returned, the current IDMR dean asked him not to prosecute the thieves and to “just put it through insurance” instead — an offer he refused.

Elder members of the Detroit branch have claimed the thieves were “anomalies” who didn’t represent IDMR’s values. But deeper analysis shows something different:
the entitlement displayed by leadership over the years had been absorbed by followers. They were not anomalies — they were the predictable product of the culture.

For decades, the Detroit dean told students that Henry Kinley himself supposedly said:
“If anyone wants to give you something, take it.”
This teaching blurred the boundaries of personal property and primed members to reinterpret other people’s belongings as spiritually available.

In practice, it created a mindset where justification and convenient reinterpretation replaced morality. As long as no worldly authority stopped them, some followers believed they were entitled to the dying woman’s possessions.

Not every dean in the organization operates this way, but the pattern is well-known across multiple branches: some leaders receive steady support from members, others accept gifts, and many quietly reinforce the idea that the founder sanctioned this behavior. Enough leaders have repeated it — or allowed it to circulate unchecked — that entitlement became part of the culture.

This exposé examines how that culture formed, how it spread, and how it ultimately produced the robbery of a dying member’s home.

The Open Letter to IDMR.  Current and former members produced an open letter, asking the IDMR for accountability and apology for derailing the lives of which members and families due to the false predictions, and end of the world doomsday prophecies. 

This video contains some soundtrack music provided by Splice.

episodes.title: IDMR End of The Age? Or End of  Credibility?
episodes.description: They could never admit the doomsday prophesies were false because it would expose the late none of this was actually divine. Just concepts.  Instead saying the reason doomsday was not yet manifested was a “ grace period “ as Kinley and others said, made the so called predictions unfalsifiable. Therefore the predictions could never be wrong, keeping them insulated from scrutiny.

episodes.title: Henry Kinley & Krishna Venta: Similarities
The Israel Effect in IDMR
episodes.description: The spiritual Israel topic wasn’t spoken on overtly in every class nor did HCK mention it often. But it was taught and members believed in this. It was compelling because it made one special and elite. Members would sometimes buy Star of David necklaces and call people who didn’t come to IDMR classes “ gentiles “. Even Kinkey was said to wear one, that surprised some of us to learn he was doing that. Why would “ God in a body “ need something to signify that? Seems like something us mortals would do.

episodes.title: Dr. Harris: Revelation or Assembly?
episodes.description:
Dr. Robert Harris’s Volume 3 of Elohim the Archetype Pattern of the Universe attempts to draw profound parallels between the human body and the biblical tabernacle. His goal was to prove that man was made in the image of Yahweh by showing that our anatomy follows the same divine pattern.

Many were deeply impressed. The idea feels elegant—like revelation. But when we slow down and examine the mechanics behind his correlations, a different picture begins to emerge.

This exposé offers an introductory look at how Harris selected and arranged these analogies. In coming segments, we plan to explore deeper discrepancies—such as the omission of vital organs like the liver, the symbolic duplication of elements (e.g., two adrenal glands to match a single furnishing), and retrofits that appear engineered to support a theological conclusion. The result is a compelling but ultimately flawed framework—one that impresses more than it proves.

episodes.title: Henry Kinley’s  Similarity to William Branham
IDMR and the Forgotten Bloodline: A Hidden Thread Through America’s Fringe Faiths
episodes.description:
With unbiased and non subjective research we’re able to peel back the layers and see the overlaps and similarities between cults and their motivations. We may never know exactly what drove Henry Kinley to build his own religious movement, but it likely wasn’t about getting rich. More plausibly, it was about validation, carving out authority in a world that may have overlooked or dismissed him. Founding a movement gave him a kind of immortality, a stage on which he could rewrite his place in history and ensure that his voice, if not his name, would echo far beyond his lifetime. 

Unlike the high-drama cults that demanded followers abandon their lives and move to remote compounds, Kinley’s movement worked more subtly, a psychological slow burn. It didn’t ask for everything all at once; it just asked for allegiance , until your thoughts, time, and identity belonged almost entirely to the system.

episodes.title: Breathing the Name ?
Panoramic Vision Pamphlet: Divine Revelation or Crafted Myth?
IDMR Survivors Ex Member NOLA Branch Testimony
IDMR Survivors Ex-Member Episode 3: Man Worship in an Unfalsifiable Loop
episodes.description: Many members come to class impressed with the information they hear open minded to learning what seems to be an endless possibility about the creator, origin and purpose of existence itself. But after the newness and mystique fades. They find themselves in a group that has a closed loop belief system. The IDMR echo chamber relies on catchphrases like  “Nothing escapes the pattern” which sounds inexhaustible and fascinating. But in reality, it creates an unfalsifiable closed loop system. Everything must be interpreted to fit within the prescribed framework. Henry Kinley created a brilliant belief system that is self affirming.

episodes.title: Ex-LA IDMR Survivor Testimony
IDMR Survivors Testimony
IDMR Ministers Meeting 2025 Forecast
IDMR Upcoming Ministers Meeting: What to Expect ?
Is Henry Kinley’s Honorary Doctorate Verified?
Noah’s Flood: IDMR Endorsed - Historical Document or A Primitive Tale ?
episodes.description:
Probably the most unrealistic story in the entire Bible is Noah's flood. There's dozens of principles that all depend on defying all laws of nature that rely on a series of miracles and lots of magic to fill all the gaps. ￼prime example: Spirit Law or the so-called “law of nature” shows that water evaporates, condenses in the atmosphere, and then precipitates as an immutable self sustaining cycle. The Noah’s flood story asks the modern person to believe this simple law was radically different. That it had never rained before? Do we also believe in Santa Claus ? 

Henry Kinley seemed to give validity to the story professing how the story of the flood" fits the pattern." as he contorted subjective principles such as " the blood upon their heads" a metaphor not a literal show of blood, is an example of such a contortion he used to assert that principles of blood water and spirit are found here. Also the principle of
40. The reason there are so many "40's" throughout the especially Old Testament and also some in the New Testament is because in biblical times the number 40 to noted " a long period of time" in days exceeding a month or " moon" 28 day. In years 40 it's about two "generations.." . But it is not an accurate scaled measurement it's approximate. This is why so many 40's appear in the text of the Bible.

episodes.title: Calculating the Losses of IDMR’s Perpetual Doomsday
Did H.C. Kinley’s 1961 Book Cause Pope John XIII to Call an Ecumenical Council?
episodes.description: Kinley alluded in his literature and lectures that his revelations and exposure of the errors of the Roman Catholic Church were the direct cause of Pope John XXII to call the 21st Ecumenical Council. Although there is no direct evidence that the pope or the Vatican ever interacted with Kinley’s work. More importantly, this Ecumenical Council was planned and announced on January 25, 1959. That newly elected pope had expressed a desire to “update the churches teachings.” Known by a Latin term: “ an aggiromento “. The post World War II era gradually saw many changes to the western developed world lifestyle. In 1946 for example only 8000 homes had television sets, compared to 1959 over 52 million homes had television sets. Interstate highways, facilitating quicker travel throughout the country. The expansion of media connecting rapid transmission of information across hemispheres. Other factors such as the development of the birth control, which were amongst groundbreaking innovations that changed American lifestyles and caused more women to enter the workforce. The Roman Catholic Church could no longer appeal to the old world mindset. They needed to make changes, and loosen restrictions to stay appealing to the modern world. The claim that the 1961 release of “ God the Archetype ( Original ) Pattern of the Universe “ had any bearing on the decision for Vatican or Pope John XXIII ￼to call for the 21st Ecumenical Council on January 25, 1959 is easily debunked since the timing of H.C. Kinley’s book didn’t go out until later in 1961. Our aim here is to show that this narrative that IDMR had a profound impact on the world is not corroborated with outside evidence.

episodes.title: Dr. Henry C. Kinley Visits Branch Schools
When the Stars Align: The High Cost of IDMR Headquarters Doomsday Obsession
Dr. Bob: Bully? Or Savior of IDMR?
Ashes of the Truth: Kinley’s Return
episodes.description:
In this video, we explore the hypothetical scenario of HC Kinley rising from the dead and visiting the school he left behind 48 years ago. His last visit to IDMR Los Angeles was December 1975. What will he see upon his return? Will he be pleased with how his followers faithfully preserved his Vision? Will it be as he left it? Will their revelry in his name and their praises for their leaders leave him pleased or devastated?

Watch till the end to find out.

episodes.title: The Apostasy of Bob Harris and the Decline of IDMR Los Angeles
episodes.description:
At the request of a channel subscriber, this letter was drafted to explore the specific teachings of Dr. Robert Harris that moved the institute away from original doctrine taught by the founder of HC Kinley. 

Harris served as the second international dean of the IDMR from 1971 to 2018, when he passed at the age of 98 years. Beginning around 1990, Harris oversaw the systematic destruction of IDMR's core values and beliefs, and upended decades of lectures when he introduced concepts such as the fallen angels, Yahshua saving himself, the red man in the cloud, the need to worship a man on the ground, and more. 

We hope you enjoy this deep dive into Harris's progressive revelations. As long as this letter is, we've only scratched the surface, attempting to hit the most significant examples of Harris most divisive teachings that divided the IDMR and led a majority of the organization into apostasy.

You may enjoy this letter more on a faster playback speed.

episodes.title: The Forgotten Co-Founder: Carl F. Gross and The Shrouded Origins of the IDMR
episodes.description: Our latest letter explores the experience of IDMR co-founder Carl F. Gross with some never before details on this final days and treatment at the hand of the membership who he gave his life to support. We challenge the listener to weigh whether this IDMR luminary has gotten his just desert and full credit or if he was pushed into the shadows as the school preferred to worship and praise HC Kinley.

episodes.title: High Control Tactics in IDMR’s Covid-19 Response
The Great Migration: Unraveling the Hidden Causes Behind the Exodus to Los Angeles
episodes.description:
This letter examines the true motivations for the IDMR's massive migration to Los Angeles and Banning, CA over the last 15 years and the significant impact on their branches and members. 

The IDMR history of pilgrimages is well established dating back to the original move from Ohio to Los Angeles in 1958, the outreach of deans leaving California beginning in 1966 to set up schools in locations such as NY, Georgia, Arkansas, and Michigan, and then the culmination of a great return after Harris failed to predict the end of the world on four separate occasions. We hypothesize that the motivations were much more than the patching of Robert Harris' bruised ego at all of the empty seats, but a reflection of his deeper understanding that without drastic action, the school would fade into oblivion after his demise. Brilliantly, he stirred his most faithful to action, bringing them home to LA, reinvigorating a power base for the Institute to heal its wounds of failure and rise from the ashes. Sadly, the rest of the school has suffered in the wake of such a bold move, and the IDMR will never be the same.

episodes.title: The Dangers of Cult-like Mentalities: A Personal Journey
episodes.description: This letter encourages us to self examine the personal traits that draw us to a high control group like a moth to a flame. In being self-aware, we can better equip our selves to be more resistant to future entrapments. Many people who escape one cult are easily drawn to another if they don't address the underlying causes. It's also important to see that a high control group can exist in many different domains of life outside of religion, including politics and self-help groups.

episodes.title: Examining the Contradictions of Henry Kinley’s Doctrine on the “True Names”
episodes.description: This letter aims to show how Kinley's changing position on the importance of the true names was a late addition to the IDMR's core teaching, only surfacing with prevalence in the last 8 years of Kinley's 45 year ministry. This calls into question the concept that he had received a vision and revelation that was all encompassing from the start, and indicates a progressive revelation that evolved and changed over the years.

episodes.title: Henry’s California Dreamin’
episodes.description: This video hypothesizes on other possible motivations for Kinley's desire to move to Hollywood than the stated purpose of getting his vision into the movies. Listen for more details!

episodes.title: Unmasking Hypocrisy: The Double Dealing of IDMR in Propping Up Aaron Bryant.
episodes.description:
This letter boldly challenges the IDMR's practice of man worship. Our aim is to shed light on the toxicity of demanding followers to worship a leader as God, despite clear evidence against it. This harmful practice not only misguides individuals but also perpetuates a cycle of control and manipulation.

We take drug use and addiction seriously and do not make light of these issues. Substance abuse is a complex and pervasive problem that requires compassionate and comprehensive support. We empathize with those affected and strongly encourage them to seek help through appropriate channels, including medical professionals, support groups, and rehabilitation programs.

Similarly, we urge those ensnared by the delusion of worshiping a flawed human as God to seek assistance. The psychological and emotional toll of such beliefs can be profound, leading to a loss of personal autonomy and critical thinking. We advocate for mental health support and counseling for those seeking to break free from these harmful doctrines.

It is essential to foster an environment where individuals can reclaim their sense of self-worth and autonomy, free from the oppressive influence of misguided worship. By raising awareness and offering support, we hope to empower those affected to pursue healthier, more fulfilling paths in life.

episodes.title: What Did Katie Know ?
episodes.description: This piece aims to focus our attention on the lived experience of the wife of Henry Clifford Kinley and invite the reader to question what she may have seen and known about the IDMR's true origins and the pain and suffering she endured when she was abandoned for another woman and family.

episodes.title: Debunking the Phenomenal Day Doctrine of Henry Kinley: An In-Depth Analysis
episodes.description: This letter examines Kinley's explanation for how Yahshua raised from the dead on the 3rd day. This is a deep mystery in Christianity, which is ironic because the Death, Burial, and Resurrection on the 3rd day is the Gospel, according to the Apostle Paul. It is the core of Christian faith, and the reason they went out to colonize the world. Ministers have even offered money for someone to show how this was possible, given the crucifixion on Friday and the resurrection on Sunday. Many IDMR believe that Kinley was the only one who had ever successfully explained this, "day known only to Yahweh." And in so doing, believers in the IDMR use this as one of their primary proofs in justifying the worship of Kinley as God.

episodes.title: The Migratory Pattern: Cultural Narrative, Lies, or Fantastical Tale of Ideology?
episodes.description: This video highlights the lack of any objective and verifiable evidence of the story of the Exodus and the existence of Moses. This has profound implications on the substance of Henry Kinley's teaching, which is primarily based on the tabernacle from Moses's vision. If this did not occur, because Moses was not a real person, then everything unravels.

episodes.title: The Devastating Effects of Predestination & Mental Health and Wellbeing: A Look Inside the IDMR
episodes.description: An argument on the dangers of predestination. Also, points out that IDMR makes use of this philosophy despite saying it is does not borrow any ideology from other religions.

episodes.title: Examining IDMR’s Blood, Water, Spirit, & 40: A Critical Analysis of Metaphysical Patterns
episodes.description: This essay critiques core IDMR doctrine. The channel has long been criticized for only writing about the people or headquarters, and accused us of ignoring the teaching, which they assert is infallible. Here, we lay bare a core doctrine: the principles of blood, water, spirit, and 40 overturning through the scriptures. We show where and when these principles work well, and where they don't, calling into the question the use of this doctrine to prove the divine authenticity, the unerring accuracy, and the absolute infallibility of the Bible.

episodes.title: Why IDMR Cannot Acknowledge Failure
episodes.description: This article examines the depths of why IDMR cannot change and is caught between the proverbial "rock and a hard place."

episodes.title: Paradox of Divinity and Disarray in the IDMR
episodes.description: This essay shows the stark contrast of IDMR's claims and its outcomes, challenging the reader to honestly weigh how an organization established by God could have so many faults.

episodes.title: Questions for IDMR International Minister’s Meeting
episodes.description:
In recent weeks, IDMR International, at the bequest of the International Dean & VP, announced the unprecedented action of scheduling a series of International Minister's Meetings to get in front of the "many and repeated questions" cropping up all over the country. The first session will be held this coming Saturday, March 30, 2024 (Easter Weekend).  

As the students all over Southern California gather to present themselves before Pat Nelson, International Superintendent at the Founder's Church in Los Angeles, CA this weekend, we who represent the many tired masses of the disenfranchised IDMR members have drafted a list of suggested questions to kick off the first session. These were mailed to Pat Nelson through the United States Postal Service and should have arrived by Thursday, March 28, 2024. 

Our earnest desire is that these questions are addressed honestly and truthfully, with love. And that they help set the tone for a new era of transparency and openness from IDMR leadership as we look forward to future sessions. 

Let the doors of the church open and feel the rush of fresh air filling the assembly!

episodes.title: Voices Unseen: The Power of Collective Anonymity in Challenging the Unquestionable
episodes.description: Here we respond to the incessant attacks from IDMR headquarters on the decision to write and publish anonymously.

Eight Criteria for Thought Reform
episodes.description: Dr. Robert Jay￼ Lifton Ph.D is an American psychiatrist and author, chiefly known for his studies of the psychological causes and effects of wars and political violence, and for his theory of thought reform. He was an early proponent of the techniques of psychohistory. Many psychologist, who study religious cults such as the most famous Margaret Thaler Singer have studied along side Lifton and refer to his analysis to understand how thought reform a.k.a. brainwashing is used by religious, political, and other types of cults. ￼
